poem:
Katherine's Mole

A moonlit mole—  
dismissed, overlooked—  
a humorous woman  
in two clinics.  
  
The humor turns,  
melanoma whispers  
in the skin's quiet layers—  
a second telling.  
  
Life's unexpected script,  
a comedian finds  
wit in shadows.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Comedian Katherine Ryan reveals second skin cancer diagnosis Comedian Katherine Ryan has received her second skin cancer diagnosis after raising concerns about a mole on her arm. She attended a private clinic where a doctor who also works on the NHS dismissed her concerns about melanoma and gave her the all-clear, before attending another private clinic where a test revealed the mole was cancerous. The 41-year-old was previously diagnosed with stage two melanoma in her". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
